# GPU compute for AI, machine learning and more

GPU

On-demand GPUs for parallel processing workloads such as machine learning,
scientific computing, and video processing.

Learn More  Contact Sales

**View product documentation>**

# GPU compute for AI, machine learning and more

GPU

On-demand GPUs for parallel processing workloads such as machine learning,
scientific computing, and video processing.

Learn More  Contact Sales

**View product documentation>**

##

GPU

Scientists, artists, and engineers need access to significant parallel
computational power. Offering GPU-optimized virtual machines accelerated by
the NVIDIA Quadro RTX 6000, harnessing the power of CUDA, Tensor, and RT cores
to execute complex processing, deep learning, and ray tracing workloads.

* * *

### On-demand GPU

Between purchasing, installing, and maintaining GPUs, the cost of ownership is
often high. Leverage the power of GPUs while benefiting from the main value
proposition of cloud: turning a capital expense into an operating expense.

### Market Leading Hardware

GPUs are NVIDIA Quadro RTX 6000 units, currently considered one of the best in
market GPUs. With CUDA, Tensor, and RT cores in each unit, these GPUs support
any use cases associated with parallel processing, deep learning, or ray
tracing.

### Simplifying Complex Use Cases

You focus on your core competencies, we’ll worry about the hardware that makes
them possible. Cloud GPUs remove the barrier of entry for complex use cases
such as machine learning, AI, and video streaming.

### Multiple Plan Types

One GPU card isn’t enough for your projected workloads? Not a problem. GPU
plans offer up to four cards per instance, depending on how much horsepower
you need.

#### Specifications

####  Technical Specifications

  * Dedicated vCPU cores: 8-24 cores
  * Memory: 32GB - 128GB
  * SSD Storage: 640GB - 7200 GB
  * Transfer: 16-20TB
  * Network In: 40 Gbps
  * Network Out: 10 Gbps
  * Dedicated IPv4 and IPv6 addresses
  * Standard Linux Distributions
  * Deploy via Custom Image, StackScript
  * Direct console access through Lish
  * Provision via Cloud Manager or CLI
  * Programmatic management via our API
  * Multi-queue NIC support
  * Available in selection regions

####  Free Bundled Services

  * Always-on DDoS Protection
  * Domain management with DNS Manager
  * Network security with Cloud Firewalls
  * Private Layer 2 networks with VLANs
  * Monitoring via Cloud Manager, Longview
  * Deployment scripts with StackScripts

####  Complementary Paid Services

  * Data protection with Backups service
  * Add additional storage with Block Storage
  * Create reusable images with Custom Images
  * Advanced monitoring via Longview Pro
  * Incident response with Managed Services
  * Add scalable storage with Object Storage

####  Recommended Workloads

  * Accelerated data science models
  * Machine learning applications
  * Artificial intelligence analysis
  * Parallel processing workloads
  * 3D modeling and design applications

In order to see embedded videos, you must have "functional" cookies enabled in
your cookie preferences.

##

Quadro RTX 6000 Specs

CUDA Cores (Parallel-Processing)  |  4,608  
---|---  
Tensor Cores (Machine & Deep Learning)  |  576  
RT Cores (Ray Tracing)  |  72  
GPU Memory  |  24 GB GDDR6  
RTX-OPS  |  84T  
Rays Cast  |  10 Giga Rays / Sec  
FP32 Performance  |  16.3 TFLOPS  
  
# Leading Price-Performance

**GPU Benchmarking:** Independent benchmarking firm, Cloud Spectator, found
our GPUs deliver the best performance per dollar when compared to AWS, Azure,
and GCP.  

Read the Report

**Particle Physics Performance Per Dollar**

Also recommended: Infographic: The Business Case for GPUs in the Cloud

## Your cookie choices for this website>

We use cookies to ensure the fast reliable and secure operation of this
website, to improve your website experience, to enable certain social media
interactions and to manage your cookie choices. Some cookies process personal
identifiable information. By continuing to visit our websites you are agreeing
to our use of cookies. Click “Manage Preferences” to make individual choices
and get details on the cookies in use and the processing activities. You can
access the Cookie Management Page at any time via the Cookie Settings link in
the footer. For additional information relating to your privacy take a look at
our Privacy Statement.
